title: Definitions and basic properties of transitive closures

blocks.name: ctcl
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include the transitive closure symbol.
blocks.origin: const class ctcl { t+ }

blocks.name: diff.ctcl.s
diff.ctcl.c
diff.ctcl.w
crtcl
blocks.content: Extend class notation with reflexive-transitive closure.
blocks.origin: const class crtcl { t* }

blocks.name: diff.crtcl.s
diff.crtcl.c
diff.crtcl.w
df-trcl
blocks.content: Transitive closure of a relation. This is the smallest superset which has the transitive property. (Contributed by FL, 27-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: df-rtrcl
blocks.content: Reflexive-transitive closure of a relation. This is the smallest superset which is reflexive property over all elements of its domain and range and has the transitive property. (Contributed by FL, 27-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: trcleq1
blocks.content: Equality of relations implies equality of transitive closures. (Contributed by RP, 9-May-2020.)

blocks.name: trclsslem
blocks.content: The transitive closure (as a relation) of a subclass is a subclass of the transitive closure. (Contributed by RP, 3-May-2020.)

blocks.name: trcleq2lem
blocks.content: Equality implies bijection. (Contributed by RP, 5-May-2020.)

blocks.name: cvbtrcl
blocks.content: Change of bound variable in class of all transitive relations which are supersets of a relation. (Contributed by RP, 5-May-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: trcleq12lem
blocks.content: Equality implies bijection. (Contributed by RP, 9-May-2020.)

blocks.name: trclexlem
blocks.content: Existence of relation implies existence of union with Cartesian product of domain and range. (Contributed by RP, 5-May-2020.)

blocks.name: trclublem
blocks.content: If a relation exists then the class of transitive relations which are supersets of that relation is not empty. (Contributed by RP, 28-Apr-2020.)

blocks.name: trclfvg
blocks.content: The value of the transitive closure of a relation is a superset or (for proper classes) the empty set. (Contributed by RP, 8-May-2020.)

blocks.name: trclfvcotrg
blocks.content: The value of the transitive closure of a relation is always a transitive relation. (Contributed by RP, 8-May-2020.)

blocks.name: reltrclfv
blocks.content: The transitive closure of a relation is a relation. (Contributed by RP, 9-May-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm reltrclfv(class c0, class c1) {

  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wrel(c0), wss(cfv(ctcl, c0), cun(c0, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0)))))
  trclfvub(c0, c1)
  3syl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wrel(c0)), wceq(cun(c0, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), wrel(c0), wss(c0, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))))
  simpr(wcel(c0, c1), wrel(c0))
  relssdmrn(c0)
  biimpi(wss(c0, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), wceq(cun(c0, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))))
  ssequn1(c0, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0)))
  xpss(cdm(c0), crn(c0))

}
